section.intro.location.title: Where is the Salkantay Trek?
section.intro.location.p1: The Salkantay Trek is located in southern Peru, in the Cusco region. It starts near the town of Mollepata, about 3 hours by road from Cusco. The route crosses the Vilcabamba range, climbs above 4,600 meters, and descends through cloud forests toward

section.see.title: What places will you see on the Salkantay route?
section.see.lead: This route offers a unique mix of landscapes you won’t find on other hikes to Machu Picchu:

section.see.items.label: Humantay Lake:
section.see.items.text: turquoise mirror at the foot of glaciers.

section.see.items.label: Cloud forests:
section.see.items.text: rich in Andean flora and fauna.
Crystal‑clear rivers, waterfalls, and coffee plantations.

section.see.items.label: Arrival at Machu Picchu from Aguas Calientes:
section.see.items.text: with the option to go up by bus or on foot.

section.availability.title: SALKANTAY - PAWKARKANCHA AVAILABILITY AND PERMITS
section.availability.p1: The Salkantay route does not require a special permit like the Inca Trail, but agencies have limited group capacity. Booking in advance is recommended, especially during high season (May to September).
section.recommendations.title: RECOMMENDATIONS
section.recommendations.pack.title: What to bring for the Salkantay Trek?
section.recommendations.pack.p1: Preparation is key. Basic list of what you should bring:
section.recommendations.pack.list: Thermal layers and a change of clothes
Original passport (required to enter Machu Picchu)
section.recommendations.tips.title: Tips before doing Salkantay
section.recommendations.tips.list: Acclimatization: spend at least 2 days in Cusco before the trek.
Physical condition: a moderate fitness level is required.
Recommended season: April to October (dry season).
Book in advance to secure your spot.
Bring cash in soles: there are no ATMs on the route.
Don’t overpack: mules carry part of the gear; you carry the rest.
section.recommendations.alert.title: Prepare physically and mentally for extreme weather and altitude changes.
section.recommendations.alert.p1: Salkantay reaches up to 4,650 meters, where the air is thinner and temperatures can drop below 0 °C at night, while during the day you may feel intense heat in tropical zones. Acclimatize at least 2 days in Cusco, stay hydrated, and avoid alcohol and heavy meals. Good preparation makes the difference between enjoying the adventure or having to stop before reaching Machu Picchu.
